moves.1. e4: annotating this game for the fun... I had a lot of pleasure to have two games against bluemarble, an optimistic offensive player, in a tournament. Of course, he made clear mistakes, but he is a cool fighter: thanks to him.
moves.1... c5: try to develop this sicilian i know so badly
moves.2. f4: damn, what is that??? I have to study theory... i hate that. I hate openings :-)
moves.2... Nc6 3. Nf3 d6 4. h3: I don't see the point of this move. It is barely a development. If Bg4, then it is justified. But if my bishop does that move, then take his knight, i lose a tempo in opening. Would not be a good idea.
moves.5. Nc3 Bg7: here it is. If you want to disturb me with black you know what you have to do.
moves.6. a4: well, heu... I am disturbed here....
moves.8... d5 9. Ba2: clear white bishop blocked for a good time
moves.9... a6 10. d4 cxd4 11. Nxd4 Nb4: this was not necessary, but i had in mind the possibility to go on c6 with my other knight... and then, well,... i changed my mind after...
moves.12. O-O Nxa2: and to avoid having lost a tempo, i decided to annoy the rook there... not very clever from me.
moves.13. Rxa2 Bd7 14. b4: considering the white pieces, you could hardly say there is a plan...
moves.16. Qxd4 axb5: and this is the gained pawn
moves.17. a5 Rxa5 18. Rxa5 Qxa5: now this won't be an easy pawn to keep as it is doubled.
moves.19... O-O: could look like a mistake, but, i have told to my self that, by now, my knig was in bad condition and a target to too many possible attack.
moves.20. Nxd5: so i let him win this pawn back...
moves.20... Qd8: am i that bad? considering now, you could say so. My only advantage here is the pair of bishop and the dark one is not very active...
moves.23. Qxd8 Rxd8 24. Bb4 Bf8 25. Ba5 Bc5+: making them all active in 3 moves. But i have to thank my opponent
moves.26. Kh2 b6: i start seeing the mate here
moves.27. Be1 Rd4 28. Kg3 Ra4: he cannot take my rook: it would mean the end of the game
moves.29. Rd1 Ra2: this is where the pair of bishop forbid all defence for this pawn on c column
moves.30. Kg4 Rxc2 31. Rd8+: not even afraid of the threats Bh4-f6x... seen why?
moves.31... Kg7 32. Rc8: but i am not sure he has seen it
moves.32... Rxg2+: now it is almost forced mate... there is a possible prolungation with the loss of the bishop on g3, but...
